[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::decrypt_own_share()] [Share leakage] Can the Transcript::decrypt_own_share() method leak information about other validators' shares through side channels, enabling an attacker to reconstruct shares they shouldn't have access to? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::get_dealt_public_key()] [Public key forgery] Can an attacker manipulate the Transcript to cause get_dealt_public_key() to return a public key that doesn't correspond to the actually dealt secret, enabling validator impersonation attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript] [Replay attacks] Does the re-exported Transcript trait properly handle session_id to prevent replay attacks where old transcripts are resubmitted in new DKG rounds, potentially reusing compromised secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::deal()] [RNG predictability] Can an attacker predict or influence the RNG used in Transcript::deal() to generate predictable randomness for transcript encryption, enabling ciphertext manipulation attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::verify()] [Encryption key validation] Does Transcript::verify() properly validate that encryption public keys (eks) are valid and belong to the correct validators? Can attackers substitute encryption keys to decrypt shares for other validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::get_public_key_share()] [Share indexing] Can get_public_key_share() be exploited with out-of-bounds Player indices to access or corrupt memory, potentially leaking secret key shares or causing crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript] [Zero-knowledge bypass] Does the Transcript trait properly enforce zero-knowledge properties? Can a malicious dealer create transcripts that leak information about the InputSecret before reconstruction threshold is met? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::deal()] [Dealer authentication] Can the dealer parameter in Transcript::deal() be forged or manipulated to attribute transcripts to the wrong validator, enabling impersonation attacks in DKG? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::decrypt_own_share()] [Wrong share attack] Can an attacker cause decrypt_own_share() to return incorrect DealtSecretKeyShare values that pass verification but lead to wrong key reconstruction, compromising DKG correctness? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::verify()] [Parameter mismatch] Can Transcript::verify() be exploited by providing mismatched SecretSharingConfig, PublicParameters, or encryption keys that cause verification to pass for invalid transcripts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript::get_dealers()] [Dealer list forgery] Can the get_dealers() method return incorrect dealer lists, allowing attribution attacks or enabling transcripts to claim false dealer participation in DKG aggregation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Transcript] [Serialization vulnerabilities] Since Transcript requires ValidCryptoMaterial, can malformed serialized transcripts bypass validation and inject malicious data that compromises DKG security when deserialized? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript (re-export)] [Aggregation bypass] Can the re-exported AggregatableTranscript trait allow aggregation of transcripts from non-overlapping dealer sets, enabling an attacker to combine incompatible transcripts and break DKG security? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript::aggregate_with()] [Double aggregation] Can a single transcript be aggregated multiple times through aggregate_with(), allowing an attacker to give some dealers disproportionate weight in the final DKG output and bias the result? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript] [Configuration mismatch] Can transcripts with different SecretSharingConfig parameters be aggregated together, causing the final aggregated transcript to have inconsistent or broken threshold properties? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript::aggregate_with()] [Commutativity violation] If aggregate_with() is not commutative or associative, can the order of aggregation be exploited to produce different final transcripts, causing consensus divergence among validators? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript] [Empty aggregation] Can the AggregatableTranscript::aggregate() helper function be exploited with empty transcript vectors to bypass validation, or can single-transcript aggregation skip security checks? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript::aggregate_with()] [Mutation vulnerability] Since aggregate_with() mutates self, can race conditions during concurrent aggregation lead to inconsistent state or double-free vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript] [Threshold accumulation] During aggregation of multiple transcripts, can the threshold t be incorrectly accumulated, resulting in a final transcript with wrong threshold requirements that compromise security? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript::aggregate()] [Vector manipulation] Can the aggregate() function's vector manipulation (split_at_mut, truncate, pop) be exploited to cause out-of-bounds access or corrupt aggregated transcript data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript::aggregate_with()] [Error propagation] If aggregate_with() returns an error, is partial aggregation state properly rolled back? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript] [Signature aggregation] During transcript aggregation, can signature aggregation be exploited to forge multi-signatures that appear to come from dealers who never contributed, enabling Sybil attacks in DKG? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript::aggregate_with()] [Share combining] Can the method incorrectly combine encrypted shares during aggregation, causing some validators to receive wrong shares that break key reconstruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: AggregatableTranscript] [Dealer duplication] Can the same dealer contribute multiple transcripts that get aggregated together, allowing malicious validators to gain outsized influence over the final DKG secret? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/traits/mod.rs] [Trait: Reconstructable (re-export)] [Threshold enforcement] Can the re-exported Reconstructable trait's reconstruction algorithm be exploited with fewer than t shares by manipulating the SecretSharingConfig or providing crafted share values?
